title: O.T. Interesting article and interesting comments
text:
This may be related to local culture, even down to the department level.

My department provided complimentary coffee for all defenses. Students optionally brought cookies or donuts - or not.

From a European visitor, I heard that elaborate food service is more common there although it is unclear who pays for it. He joked, when asked how was the thesis, sometimes the best response was that feast was good.

Unrelated, in old times, in the UK, the committee could approve the thesis for MS or PhD. Don't know if this is still done. In the US, result would be pass or fail or re-try.

At one time, theses were graded in some countries [Germany, Russia, etc]. A famous example is Mendeleev's thesis on periodic table that got C. Until some new elements were discovered based on the gaps, many didn't think much of it.

YBB
description: "It’s a common tradition within graduate programs: students bring food and drinks to meetings with their thesis committees, especially to their - 19507
